com.bluegosling.graph

Class Node.Input<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.graph.Node.Input<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the input
    Enclosing class:
    Node<T>

    public abstract static class Node.Input<T>
extends Object
    An input to a node. An input is an incoming edge in the graph. The other side of the edge can either be another node or a key. Keys represent inputs to the graph that must be supplied when the graph is executed.

    An input can be optional. The node's operation is invoked even if computation of the optional input failed. The node's operation accepts a Result for optional inputs, which can represent a successful value for the input or a failure.

    An input can also be asynchronous, which allows the execution one node's operation to run concurrently with the computation of one of its input. The node's operation accepts a future for the input if it is asynchronous. (Asynchronous inputs are implicitly optional since the future could complete unsuccessfully.)

    • Method Detail

      • key

        public Key<?> key()
        Returns the key associated with this input. If this input edge is connected to a node, not a key, then null is returned.

        The actual type of the returned key depends on whether it is asynchronous or optional. If it is asynchronous or optional, then this input's type will be FluentFuture<V> where the key's type will be V. But if the input is synchronous and required, the type of the key is the same as the type of the input.

        Returns:
        the key associated with this input or null if not associated with a key
        See Also:
        node()

      • node

        public Node<?> node()
        Returns the node associated with this input. If this input edge is associated with a key, not a node, then null is returned.

        The actual type of the returned node depends on whether it is asynchronous or optional. If it is asynchronous or optional, then this input's type will be FluentFuture<V> where the node's type will be V. But if the input is synchronous and required, the type of the node is the same as the type of the input.

        Returns:
        the node associated with this input or null if not associated with a node
        See Also:
        key()

      • isAsync

        public abstract boolean isAsync()
        Returns true if this is an asynchronous input or not. An asynchronous input's type is FluentFuture.
        Returns:
        true if this is an asynchronous input or not

      • isOptional

        public abstract boolean isOptional()
        Returns true if this is an optional input or not. An optional input's type is Result, so that the node can see if the associated operation was successful or not.
        Returns:
        true if this is an optional input or not
